title: Talent Enablement Advisor, China (HRBP)
content:
Airbnb was born in 2007 when two Hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 4 million Hosts who have welcomed more than 1 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, Hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.The Community You Will Join:
Airbnb’s Talent Enablement (HR) team delivers the core components of Talent services, including advising managers and employees on people matters, supporting the planning and delivery of cyclical talent programs, collaborating with EX COEs on global and countrywide program delivery, partnering with functional experts on research and investigations, and supporting function specific projects, among other responsibilities and opportunities. The Talent Enablement Advisor also handles the most complex HR matters, situations and projects.
 
The Difference You Will Make:
The Talent (HR) Enablement Advisor is an instrumental role in Airbnb’s Talent (HR) model and is uniquely positioned to deliver concrete solutions to Airbnb’s workforce in China. This role is responsible for ensuring Airbnb HR services are delivered timely, accurately and with high quality across the entire employee journey.
This is a highly cross functional role and requires strong engagement and partnership with teams across Airbnb, including business, Employee Experience/HR, and global/regional teams. We are looking for a HR thought professional who can balance the need to be a strong, data-driven business partner and a roll up your sleeves attitude. The successful candidate thrives in a fast-paced and challenging environment and is passionate  to deliver impactful talent solutions. The position reports to the Talent Leader for China.
 
A Typical Day: 

Gain strong understanding of the business, and business strategies and roadmaps.
Has a comprehensive understanding of HR fundamentals and some HR disciplines; able to solve a broad range of issues across every HR discipline.
Demonstrates strong project management capabilities and experience. Look around corners to improve current processes and programs.
Builds plans that effectively execute strategies for Talent Programs.
Partner with Talent Business Partners, EX Centers of Expertise (COE) to plan, manage and support cyclical programs including (but not limited to) performance management, annual compensation reviews, talent reviews and employee listening. Share content and process feedback with COE teams to ensure continuous improvement.
Partner with key functional teams to ensure a stellar client experience including the Legal team to ensure compliance with employment regulations; Total Rewards in relation to compensation and benefits clarity and guidance; Talent Ops on talent processes/projects.
Proactively uses data analysis and analytical thought to identify trends and areas of opportunity.
Build awareness among managers and employees of EX self service support. Wherever possible, enable the workforce to effectively resolve inquiries and matters independently.
Detect potential trends and patterns to inform organizational insights and contribute towards proactive planning and issue mitigation.
Promote, strengthen and embed Airbnb Core Values and Diversity and Belonging across the organization.

 
Your Expertise:
* Professional Skills & Experience:

Possesses solid experience in and knowledge of core HR disciplines, including HR Operations, Employee Relations, Compensation, Benefits, Recruiting, Talent Management, Organization Development and Change Management.
Expert program management skills and experience in leading complex cross-functional projects.
Strong ability to use the data to obtain the insights and to come up with the recommendations. 
Strong communication (written, verbal and electronic) and relationship building skills. Able to establish strong communication channels with stakeholders (business teams, EX and COEs). 
Proven problem solving experience. Identifies problems, proposes solutions, and executes effectively with appropriate COE partners with minimal guidance.
Deep understanding of how business works and how specific business teams and functions drive Airbnb’s one company roadmap and goals.
Practices trustworthiness, discretion, confidentiality, empathy and sound judgment.
Centers on customer impact and implications in order to solve the right issues in an appropriate time frame.
Deep sense of curiosity and enjoys learning how things work and delights in solving thorny problems responsibly and creatively.

* Education, Work Experience and Extras:

10+ years of progressive HR experience in fast moving, high growth, global companies.
BA/BS degree in an HR related field is a big plus; MA/MS preferred. Educational specialization is highly preferred (Organizational Behavior, Organization Development, Statistics,  etc).
Hold experience/expertise in 3+ functional HR areas (HRBP, Employee Relations, Organization Development, Talent Management, Learning and Development, Compensation, Recruiting, etc.).
Experience supporting a Technology organization as HR Generalist, HRBP or program manager is required.
Experience with HR/Data/Analytics technologies (Workday, Tableau, Excel) and Program Management tools (Smartsheet, Asana, Airtable) is required.
Prior experience working in fast-paced, dynamic, global/multinational organizations is highly preferred.
Strong commitment to customers and the customer experience (internal and external customers).
Enjoys having fun doing meaningful work with business clients and colleagues.
Fluency in communication and writing  in English and Mandarin

 
Your Location
Due to the nature of this position, the successful applicant will need to be based in Beijing, China to be able to conduct their work. Your recruiter will inform you what cities you are able to work from depending on your personal legal working identity and Airbnb internal policies.
 
Our Commitment To Inclusion & Belonging:
Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.

I acknowledge that I am applying for employment by Airbnb Information Technology (Beijing) Co., Ltd. (the “Company”), and I hereby consent to the Company collecting, processing and using my personal information for the following purposes: 

  • To contact and communicate with me in connection with my application; •
  • To discuss and evaluate my application;
  • To conduct any background checks or similar activities; and
  • To conduct, or to comply with any lawful order or request made in connection with, any investigation or proceeding, or to otherwise deal with any grievance, by, against or otherwise involving me. 

I also consent to the Company and its affiliated entities:

  • In conjunction with the above, disclosing or transferring any part or all of my personal information to any of its affiliated entities and/or to any of the Company’s or its affiliated entities’ vendors or service providers, and to transfer or store the same to or in any part of the world;
  • Retaining any or all of my personal information for such period as it may determine to be appropriate, including for audit or compliance purposes anywhere in the world;
  • Disclosing and using any or all of my personal information where reasonably required for purposes of evaluating my application; and
  • Permitting or authorizing of any of its affiliated entities to do any of the things that the Company is permitted to do under this document. 

In this document, “my personal information” includes but is not limited to my name; address; gender, ID number or passport number; birth date; photograph(s); contact information such as telephone number(s), email address(es) and residential address; educational, professional and employment history, records, certifications and information; information on memberships in organizations or political groups; health and disability information; bank account and other payment information; criminal records, if any; performance information and other information you provided to us.

questions.description:
I understand and acknowledge that during my interview process with Airbnb, that Airbnb may disclose certain Airbnb Confidential Information (as defined below) to me. I agree to maintain such Confidential Information as provided in Section below.

I will: (a) hold Airbnb’s Confidential Information in strict confidence, which means that I won’t disclose it to any individual or third party for any reason without Airbnb’s written agreement; (b) use Airbnb Confidential Information only for purposes of the interview process (or during subsequent employment by Airbnb, pursuant to the terms of my employment-related confidentiality agreement); and (c) not modify, reverse engineer, decompile, create other works from, or disassemble any such Confidential Information. I agree that I will handle Airbnb Confidential Information with an appropriate degree of care, which means that, in addition to meeting the above obligations, I will not copy or transmit Airbnb Confidential Information, and that I will keep it in a secure location, whether in digital or physical format.

“Confidential Information” means all technical and non- technical information being disclosed by Airbnb to You before, during or following the interview process (including but not limited to compensation information (to the broadest extent permitted by applicable law), product information, plans and pricing, financials, marketing plans, business strategies, customer information, data, research and development, software and hardware, APIs, specifications, designs, proprietary formulae and proprietary algorithms), either directly or indirectly, in writing, orally or by inspection of tangible objects, whether or not such information is marked as "Confidential," "Proprietary," or some similar designation. Confidential Information shall also include the existence and terms of this Agreement and the fact that discussions have taken, are taking, or may take place about Your prospective employment or other business relationship.
